answers.answer: I've had this too. I now sleep with a humidifier on in the bedroom and it seems to help. I have a glass of water by my bedside too.

For some reason I get really dry and thirsty when it comes to bed time.  I drink a glass of cold water and use a special mouthwash (made for dry mouth) before bed, then have a bottle I can easily pick up and sip from throughout the night. Take note of how you're feeling,  too because thirst and dryness can be a symptom of gestational diabetes (but don't worry too much because its pretty normal!)

Do you think maybe you wake up with a dry mouth because you are sleeping with your mouth open?  Pregnancy causes the nasal passages to swell a bit so even if you normally sleep with your mouth closed,  the pregnancy may cause you to breath through your mouth while sleeping.  If that is what's happening with you,  you can try non-medicated breathe right strips. They will open up your airway and possibly fix the problem.
My mouth gets crazy dry too... Especially with the heater on.  I keep a bottle or two of water by my bed and drink some every time I go pee.
Have water by your bed, use a humidifier in your room and chapstick before u go to sleep
Thank you. I've tried everything else except the humidifier. I go through 2or 3 bottles of water a night. it's so frustrating :(
